name: rebelliously
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that shows someone does not want to be controlled or to behave as other people expect: "I don't care!" she told him rebelliously. She is rebelliously turning her back on her mother's value system.
in a way that opposes the ideas of people in authority and plans to change the system: They stood up rebelliously against the other members of their party. See
rebellious
More examplesFewer examples"Do it yourself," he muttered rebelliously under his breath.Tessa stared back at him rebelliously."I'll prove her wrong," he thought, rebelliously.Drafted into the army, he rebelliously rejected discipline.
